newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentina says IMF okays $148 mln disimbursement.
newsitem.headline: Argentina says IMF okays $148 mln disimbursement.

text.p: The Argentine government announced that the International Monetary Fund (IMF) on Tuesday approved a disimbursement of about $148 million under a stand by agreement.
The new disimbursement, the fifth under the deal, raises Argentina total outstanding debts with the Fund to $6.21 billion, the ministry of Economy said in a press release.
It was approved after the IFM verified the country met its economic goals for March, the ministry said.
There are still pending two tranches for a total of $297 million, it added.
